alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:40PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside and north central San Diego Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 539 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm on the northern slopes of Palomar Mountain, near Hwy 79 Between Oak Grove And Aguanga, or 8 miles southwest of Anza. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aguanga, Palomar Mountain State Park, Hwy 79 Between Oak Grove And Aguanga, Palomar Mountain, Hwy 79 Between Warner Springs And Oak Grove, Oak Grove, and Pauma Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Diego County Mountains
